snippet: The public collision between Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Preet Bharara, a U.S. attorney, which comes just months before the governor seeks re-election, is unlike any that the governor has faced before.
abstract: United States Atty Preet Bharara's warning to New York Gov Andrew Cuomo against soliciting statements of support from members of now-defunct ethics panel underscores Bharara's challenge to Cuomo's style of back-room operator; very public collision over Cuomo's closing of panel comes three months before he seeks re-election, and is unlike any that he has faced in his entire political career.

byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG, THOMAS KAPLAN and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

lead_paragraph: The public collision between Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Preet Bharara, a U.S. attorney, which comes just months before the governor seeks re-election, is unlike any that the governor has faced before.

headline.main: Cuomo’s Back-Room Style Draws a Potent Critic
headline.print_headline: Cuomo’s Back-Room Style Draws a Potent Critic

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations
